intro: Mortonia utahensis, commonly known as the Utah mortonia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Utah. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun, making it a hardy species in desert environments. Mortonia utahensis is often found in rocky slopes and gravelly plains, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
